ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Practice editing and workshopping others' work, practice editing and workshopping my own work, coming up with creative topics to write about, practice writing in new formats (poetry and playwriting), how to take tools and ideas from published works, consistency in writing.

This course offers a good introduction into three types of creative writing: the short story, the poem, and the play. I feel like my writing skill developed greatly over the course of the semester, particularly in playwriting, a genre I'd never attempted before. I also feel like I learned how to analyze texts for craft and offer constructive criticism in workshop.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed this class. I think it was a great mix of workshopping, class discussion, and lecturing. I felt like I improved a lot over the course of the semester, even as I was engaging with totally new writing formats.

Strengths: Deming is a fun professor! He has a very dry sense of humor, and I feel like he was very good at keeping discussions of texts engaging. His feedback too was quite clear and helpful. I feel like the amount of time we spent on each of the units was logical, and the assignments and small writing exercises in general were enjoyable. Weaknesses: I felt like the way workshops were divided up wasn't entirely fair. Some people got to have a first draft of a piece for the final portfolio workshopped, but others only got to have their monologue workshopped, which was not included in the final portfolio. As a result, I feel that the feedback a workshop is meant to provide was more useful for some than for others. This issue could be rectified if there was a set schedule for workshops, such that everyone got to have a portfolio piece looked at.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're interested in creative writing, absolutely take this course! It proved a strong introduction to poetry, fiction, and playwriting, and felt accessible to students, like me, who hadn't tried writing in one of those genres before. Also the guest lectures were super interesting and often quite amusing, and they provided good food for thought as we analyzed pieces for craft throughout the semester.
